result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:37 PM Defendant Zachary William Leofilos Radtke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Annie Gutsinger appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions.
Atty Getsinger has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
